content.en: Ovarian cancer algorithms: A set of scientific studies examined the use of algorithms in diagnosing ovarian cancer. The algorithms, including HE4, CA125, ROMA, and RMI, were tested to see if they could accurately classify patients with ovarian cancer and differentiate between benign and malignant pelvic masses. The results showed that while the algorithms had high accuracy in discriminating ovarian cancer from other benign gynecological diseases, they did not significantly improve the detection of malignant disease compared to CA125 alone. However, they did show promise in differentiating ovarian cancer from other pelvic masses, especially in early stages.
content.da: Algoritmer for ovariecancer: En række videnskabelige studier undersøgte brugen af algoritmer til at diagnosticere ovariecancer. Algoritmerne, inklusive HE4, CA125, ROMA og RMI, blev testet for at se, om de kunne klassificere patienter med ovariecancer præcist og differentiere mellem godartede og ondartede bækkenmasser. Resultaterne viste, at mens algoritmerne havde høj nøjagtighed i at adskille ovariecancer fra andre godartede gynækologiske sygdomme, forbedrede de ikke væsentligt opdagelsen af ondartet sygdom sammenlignet med CA125 alene. Dog viste de potentiel i at differentiere ovariecancer fra andre bækkenmasser, især i de tidlige stadier.
